meanings.definition: The act of making something more liberal or free.
meanings.sent1: The liberalization of the school's dress code allowed students to wear casual clothes.
meanings.sent2: The liberalization of trade policies led to increased economic growth.
meanings.sent3: The liberalization of dessert options at the cafeteria made everyone happy.
meanings.sent4: Her liberalization of the rules in the game made it more enjoyable for everyone.
meanings.sent5: The liberalization of the park's rules brought joy to all visitors.

meanings.definition: The process of removing restrictions or regulations.
meanings.sent1: The liberalization of internet access in the country opened up new opportunities for businesses.
meanings.sent2: The liberalization of visa requirements made travel easier for tourists.
meanings.sent3: The liberalization of bedtime rules at the sleepover caused excitement among the kids.
meanings.sent4: His liberalization of the project guidelines allowed for more creativity among the team.
meanings.sent5: The liberalization of parking restrictions made finding a spot much easier.
